data.title: Requeijão Caseiro
data.meta_description: Requeijão: check this recipe and learn how to make this delicious Brazilian Cream Cheese with origins in Minas Gerais and very popular all around Brazil. It will add a lot of flavors in your breakfast and can be used in many other Brazilian recipes.
data.text: Requeijão is a milk-derived product, produced in Portugal and Brazil The Brazilian product is a type of cream cheese white in color. It has a mild taste and its consistency can vary from creamy solid, like the Catupiry, to liquid. Traditionally associated with the state of Minas Gerais, the mineiro presence in Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo from the start of the 20th century on popularized it and nowadays it is produced all over the country. Its most common variant is requeijão cremoso, with a consistency similar to that of condensed milk; usually sold in glasses or plastic cups, both generally re-employed by Brazilians as usual cups.
